intro: Weinmannia bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean highlands of Colombia. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at elevations between 2,000 and 3,500 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a leathery texture, and it produces small, white to pink flowers that attract pollinators. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions.
